name: Skunk Spray
description: What to do if your pet gets sprayed by a skunk.
immediateActions: Keep your pet outdoors to prevent the smell from spreading inside.
Check your pet's eyes for redness or irritation. If affected, rinse gently with cool water or pet-safe eyewash.

steps.title: Prepare De-Skunking Solution
steps.details: Mix: 1 quart of 3% hydrogen peroxide solution (check expiry), Â¼ cup baking soda, 1-2 teaspoons of mild liquid dish soap. Mix fresh for each use; do not store.

steps.title: Apply Solution
steps.details: Wearing rubber gloves, lather your pet with the solution, avoiding eyes and mouth. Work it deep into the fur. Let it sit for about 5 minutes. Do NOT leave unattended.

steps.title: Rinse Thoroughly
steps.details: Rinse your pet completely with lukewarm water. Ensure all solution is removed, as peroxide can bleach fur and irritate skin if left too long.

steps.title: Shampoo
steps.details: Follow up with a regular pet shampoo to remove any residue.

steps.title: Towel Dry and Keep Warm
steps.details: Dry your pet thoroughly with towels and keep them in a warm place.

steps.title: Monitor Your Pet
steps.details: Watch for any signs of illness, vomiting, or excessive irritation. Skunk spray can sometimes cause anemia in dogs. Contact your vet if concerned.

name: Found a Stray Pet
description: Steps to take if you find a lost dog or cat.
immediateActions: Approach cautiously and speak calmly. Offer water if the animal seems distressed or thirsty.
Check for any visible identification tags (collar, name tag, rabies tag).

steps.title: Ensure Safety
steps.details: Keep the animal contained in a safe place (e.g., fenced yard, carrier, spare room) away from your own pets initially.

steps.title: Check for Microchip
steps.details: Take the pet to a local vet clinic or animal shelter to have it scanned for a microchip. This is often a free service.

steps.title: Notify Local Shelters & Animal Control
steps.details: Contact San Diego Humane Society, County Animal Services, and shelters in your immediate area. Provide a description of the animal, where it was found, and your contact info.

steps.title: Post Online
steps.details: Use social media (Facebook lost & found pet groups for San Diego, Nextdoor, PawBoost, Petco Love Lost) to post a photo and description of the found pet.

steps.title: Put Up Flyers
steps.details: Place 'Found Pet' flyers in the neighborhood where the animal was found.

steps.title: Legal Holding Period
steps.details: Be aware of local regulations regarding stray animals. There's usually a holding period before a found pet can be considered for rehoming.
